column5: I just got video editing program and gave it a try, with music in the background lets see if all this stuff works I couldn't figure out how to embed it in the post.....  I see when I changed it to a windows media file, it lost some detail...a work in progress         hey be nice, it is my first try  <object width="425" height="350"><param name="movie" value="
You tube is the best Terry for sharing videos you did a good job who sings that song and whats the name of it i am working on something alittle bit different hopefully ill get it out soon
Terry...great job on the video!  That's some cool perch action.  The quality is pretty good...can see the markings great.  Cliff
I don't know anything about the song..only it was fishing related and had a nitro bass boat in it, and I have a nitro bass boat..so it seemed right maybe someone else will know
Great job on the video, makes me think about the discussion about live bait or not though
great video watched it a few times already, makes me gotta get an aqua view
I'm glad you guys like it it was cool to edit..real easy so I will be doing more as I get out fishing
Hey, that's pretty cool.  So they ARE down there  Joey
Yea.... I would like the name of the artist/song if anyone has that info... and nice video too...
ok I had to do some digging and here is what I found The bass tournament song" by Rodney Clawson.  gone fishing CD from BassPro Shop
Great job Terry! Really fun video
Great vid Terry!  I've never been so excited to watch perch ice fishing.  What type of video equipment do you use? Do you find it fustrating to see the fish, but not have any takers?  Great stuff
Good stuff Terry.

I did for sure get some takers on film but I have much more where they looked and looked and didn't bite..it didn't bug me that they didn't bite I just kept trying different things...just think if you don't have a camera, how many do the same thing and you never know they are there I used the DVR recorder from aquavu
Very cool bud. Thats an awesome song. Got it burned to cd for when Im out in the boat.  Cant wait to try that camera out this weekend.
the guys are telling me that lake is too dark for the camera to work...but I will take it and see for myself I want to see crappie on video.....lol
dando, I noticed the very same thing I would have thought that they would have a lot more flowing movement but it didn't move any more then a stick bait marabou may be the way to go....
That's a very good video Terry!  I wish lake Henry was that clear right now.  What size SD card did you have in your recorder? and how many minutes did you get on it?

I have a 1gig card, but with a few hours of recording I did,  I hardly used any memory I am going to a lake this weekend that everyone has told me it's way to drity to get a picture with the camera..it will be a good test
I might take mine out and play with it some more (Aqua-Vu  ) and my next purchase will be the DVR... if the lake ever clears up!

I'd like to see the same experiment with a small BadBoyz jig and a 2 in twister tail.  Icefisherman and I were fishing for perch in late December off Georgina island in 12 feet of gin clear water.  I thought that the BB jig generated a lot more interest.
yeah  douG, I should set up a bunch of rods and types of jigs and just see how they all move
